summary.p: 73 fol.; Writing surface: parchment; Shelfmark: A. 3; Qurʾānic Text: complete muṣḥaf; 32 lines per page; Dimensions: 120 x 125mm; Script style: kūfī.

This entry is based on the catalogue of Fehmi E. Karatay (1888-1968). Currently we do not have access to the images. With exceptions, the catalogue does not contain precise information on the distribution of the text throughout the pages. For this reason, only fol. 1 is given.

Karatay (1962) describes the manuscripts as follows, p. 26: "76 A. 3. Muṣḥaf. Parşömen. 125mm boy ve 120mm eninde 73 yaprak. Sahifede gayet ince kûfi ile 80mm uzunl.[uğunda] 32 satır. Tahminen IV-V. (X-XI) asırlarda yazılmıştır. Y. 1b ve 2ada arabesk hendesi geçmeli levhalar vardır. Y. 1b de kinin üst kısmı yırtılmış ve kâğıt yapıştırılarak tamir edilmiştir. Sure başları Arap üslubunda tezhipli ve sahife kenarlarında hızıp ve secde gülleri ile duraklar yaldızla süslüdür. Son yaprakta yine aynı mahiyette hendesî geçmelerle müzeyyen bir levha vardır. Miklepli darçini deri üzerine basit şemseli cilt. Bu da tamam bir mushaftır."

This can be translated as follows: "76 A. 3. Muṣḥaf. Parchment. 73 leaves of 125 mm height and 120 mm width. Each page features very fine Kufic script, measuring 80 mm in length and containing 32 lines. Probably copied during the 4th-5th (10th-11th) century. There are borders on [Leaf] L. 1b and 2a with geometric interlaced arabesque patterns. The upper part of 1b is torn and has been repaired with paper. The beginnings of the sūras are gilded in Arabic style and the ḥizb and sajda roses in the edges, and verse seperators are gilded. The last leaf has also an illuminated border with geometric interlaced [forms]. Cinnamon color leather binding with flap (miklep) and simple a mandorla (şemse). This is also a complete codex (muṣḥaf).”
